slide02.title: Introduction
items: This session consists of two parts

Part 1 covers easy-to-understand changes,
Part 2 explains changes with terminology

slide06.title:
Custom shaders were available before Impeller,
but intermediate code was reduced for faster performance
and expanded range of expression

slide13.question:
Are Metal and Impeller
rendering engines?

slide15.title: <u>Graphics API</u>
slide15.description:
APIs provided by the OS to enable
3D rendering capabilities in apps

openglDesc: Created to standardize API specifications across operating systems
metalDesc: Apple's proprietary graphics API exclusively for Apple products
vulkanDesc: Successor to OpenGL. Breaking compatibility for a fresh spec with improved performance
Mainly used on Android and Linux since Apple moved to Metal

slide17.title: What Graphics APIs Can Do
slide17.description: For 2D drawing, there's only one main function

slide18.title: CPU
slide18.description:
The brain of the computer
(a phone with 8–16 cores is common)

slide19.title: Execute a method once for each coordinate (pixel) to determine the color

slide20.title: GPU
slide20.description: Brains specialized for graphics (hundreds to thousands on smartphones)

slide20_5.title: A single GPU core has very low performance...
slide20_5.restart:
The GPU hangup,
causing phone force restarts
slide20_5.writeShader: Write the method in GPU-specific language (shader language)

slide21.title: 2D Rendering Engine
slide21.description:
A library that achieves fast 2D drawing
by switching Graphics APIs based on the OS

slide22.title: What a 2D rendering engine can do:

slide23.title: Skia
items:
A 2D rendering engine created by Skia Inc.,
acquired by Google in 2005 and released as OSS

Used as a highly versatile 2D rendering engine in
Flutter, Chrome, Android OS, as well as
Compose Multiplatform, React Native,
Firefox, and more

slide24.title: Problems with Metal's Introduction
items: Since Metal was created by Apple who makes everything from OS to hardware, ahead-of-time compilation is recommended Just-in-time compilation isn't cached, causing compilation every time the app launches

So Skia has 0.1-0.3 seconds of compilation
on first draw (shader jank)

slide25.title: Limitations of Using with Flutter
items: Skia is developed by a specialized team within Google, making Flutter-specific optimizations difficult
Skia's GitHub repository has over 77,000 commits, on par with Flutter

slide26.title: Impeller
items: A dedicated 2D rendering engine optimized for Flutter
Eliminated shader jank with ahead-of-time compilation

Now directly managed within Flutter's repository,
making development easier

slide27.title: What Changed with Impeller
items:
New expressions like Liquid Glass Renderer
with custom shaders
3D rendering now possible with Flutter GPU
Eliminated shader jank with ahead-of-time compilation

Same team & repository as Flutter,
making development easier

slide28.title: Thank you for listening
slide28.thanks1: Special thanks to the FlutterKaigi team for allowing us to use Dashmaru
slide28.thanks2: And thank you, my fluttergpumate Smit Mehta!
